system.name: DineOut
system.description: DineOut is a restaurant management system developed with the intention of automating the day-to-day tasks in a restaurant like order and inventory management, bill generation, and taking feedback.
system.purpose: The purpose of DineOut is to improve the performance of the restaurant by eradicating the daily paperwork, minimizing human error, and reducing labor expenses.
system.scope: The scope of DineOut includes order management, inventory management, bill generation, and customer feedback. It is designed for use in restaurants and will be used by customers, managers, head chefs, admins, and chefs.

stakeholders.name: Customer
stakeholders.description: The end-user of the DineOut application who places orders and interacts with the system

stakeholders.name: Admin
stakeholders.description: The administrator of the DineOut system who manages staff members, menu items, and inventory

stakeholders.name: Head Chef
stakeholders.description: The head chef of the kitchen who assigns orders to chefs and manages the preparation of dishes

stakeholders.name: Hall Manager
stakeholders.description: The manager of the dining hall who oversees the service and receives notifications about orders and payments

stakeholders.name: Chef
stakeholders.description: The chef who prepares the dishes assigned by the head chef

stakeholders.name: Waiter
stakeholders.description: The waiter who serves the customers and assists with order management

functional_requirements.description: The system will show a list of cards (UI element) of dishes. Each card will have a picture of the dish, below the dish it shows the price in Rupees per serving.
The system must show all available and unavailable dishes to the customer.
Tap on any of the displayed dishes will result in a popup for quantity and a green mark after quantity has been selected.
The popup for quantity input will not allow the user to enter letters, negative numbers, or any invalid characters.

After completing the order, the system will display a timer 'Time to complete the order' and it is the total time required to serve the dish, keeping in view the previously queued orders, Moreover, it also shows a cancel order button.
Unavailable dishes must be displayed but their operations must be disabled.
The system must give customers the ability to ask for help.
When the customer taps on 'Call the waiter to manage order', the system must store that the above order was given by the waiter.
System will classify the dishes in the order according to category and add this dish on a particular chef's queue in the kitchen screen.
System must allow the customer to increase, decrease, or even remove the dish from the order any time before serving.
System must remove the dish or decrease quantity of the dish with the approval of the head chef.
System must allow the customer to cancel the order at any time before serving.
In cancel order, all the dishes will be presented for approval to the head chef. Only approved dishes will be dropped.
System must send a notification to the hall manager once all the dishes of a particular order have been marked 'cooked'.
System must replace the timer screen with a new screen having feedback and request bill options.
The system must notify the hall manager that a customer has requested a bill.
The system must show the hall manager the order number, table number, and total payable amount.
The system must give the ability to the hall manager to change the status of the bill to paid.
System must show the feedback screen to the user.
System must display multiple choice questions for feedback.
Admin should be able to add all necessary information about the staff member.
System must give admin the ability to edit information about all staff members.
System must give admin the ability to remove staff members.
Admin should be able to add all necessary information about the menu items.
System must give admin the ability to edit information about all menu items.
System must give admin the ability to remove menu items.
